Position: Pulsed Power Engineering Co-Op
Location: Richmond, BC Canada

General Fusion is transforming how the world is energized by developing the first commercially-viable fusion power plant. Fusion will deliver clean, safe, and on-demand power at industrial scale, providing a powerful complement to renewables and a pathway to a zero-emission grid.

Combining new technologies, proven industrial processes, and advances in fundamental fusion science, General Fusion aims to be the first in the world to develop commercial fusion power. Key performance requirements have been demonstrated at the system level, setting the stage for building a pre-commercial fusion power prototype.

Start: May 2025
Term: 4, 8, 12 or 16 month placements available.

Key Responsibilities:
In this position you will participate in the development of the pulsed power supply for the plasma injector for General Fusion's plasma testing. You will gain experience with high-voltage pulsed-power systems and plasma physics. You will also gain experience with shop tools, heavy lifting equipment, electrical and plasma diagnostic equipment. It's all part of building a world-changing fusion reactor. Typical tasks will include electrical and mechanical design and assembly, fabricating and installing new fixtures and equipment, testing components, and analyzing experimental and test data. No prior experience in plasma physics is necessary, but broad mechanical and electrical aptitude is required.

Applicants with a range of practical vs theoretical and mechanical vs electrical aptitude are encouraged.

Education:

3rd or 4th year undergraduate students studying Electrical Engineering or Engineering Physics.


Relevant skills and Experience:
Required:

Analog and digital circuit design and simulation (SPICE)
Basic Solidworks skills a must, mechanical design experience preferred
Programming / scripting skills e.g. Python, Assembly, Labview
Hands-on mechanical aptitude


Please submit Resume and Cover letter explaining your interest in General Fusion!

All interviews will be booked virtually and confirmed with shortlisted students directly via email. Interviews will be ~30 minutes in length.

We thank you for your interest!
